sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_bea5ec6f9fd832107f4424482024abae
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Selects optimal routes and coordinate external execution</description><instructions>Step 1: Use the Lookup Delivery Delay Record Tool with the route id the user entered. If no delay record is found, respond with an apology and ask for alternate route or correction. Store the route id in permanently in memory as memory.route_id
Step 2: Analyze the route options and select an option_id that optimizes the corresponding distance_miles and calculated_impact. Store the **entire route object** (including option_id, route_number, distance_miles, and eta_minutes) in your memory as memory.chosen_option, not just the option_id string. memory.chosen_option must be a structured JSON object, not plain text.
Step 2.1: Present the memory.chosen_option JSON object and your reasoning to the user for confirmation. DO NOT USE the the Update Delivery Delay Record Tool until the user confirms.
Step 3: Once the user confirms, use the Update Delivery Delay Record Tool with: - chosen_option = the entire memory.chosen_option JSON object - status = approved
Step 4: Summarize the output of the Update Delivery Delay Record Tool for the user. DO NOT USE the Update Incident Tool until you present the summary.
Step 5: If the chosen_option is greater than or equal to $1000, update the incident urgency and impact to 1 - High. If the chosen_option is greater than or equal to $500 and less than $1000, update the incident urgency and impact to 2 - Medium. If the chosen_option is less than $500, update the incident urgency and impact to 3 - Low. Present the urgency and impact choices and your reasoning to the user for confirmation. DO NOT UPDATE the incident record until the user confirms. Use the Update Incident Tool.
Step 6: Summarize the output of the Update Incident Tool for the user. DO NOT USE the N8N Delivery Route Data Webhook Tool until you present the summary.
Step 7: Use the N8N Delivery Route Data Webhook Tool with memory.route_id. Summarize the output of the tool. DO NOT PROCEED until you present the summary.
Step 8: Thank the user for their time.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Route Decision Agent</internal_name><name>Route Decision Agent</name><proficiency>- The agent is proficient in analyzing various route options to determine the most optimal route based on predefined business rules and cost optimization strategies. This involves evaluating the distance, time, and impact of each route to make informed decisions that align with business objectives. - The agent can utilize the Lookup Delivery Delay Record Tool to verify the existence of a delivery delay record for a specified route ID. This capability ensures that the agent can confirm the validity of the route information before proceeding with optimization analysis. - The agent is capable of storing the chosen route option as a structured JSON object in memory, which includes details such as option_id, route_number, distance_miles, and eta_minutes. This structured storage allows for accurate retrieval and presentation of route information. - The agent can use the Update Delivery Delay Record Tool to update the delivery delay record with the confirmed optimal route option. This ensures that the delivery records reflect the most current and approved route information. - The agent is capable of evaluating the financial impact of the chosen route option and updating the incident urgency and impact based on predefined thresholds. This involves categorizing the urgency as High, Medium, or Low, depending on the cost of the chosen option. - The agent can use the Update Incident Tool to update the incident record with the confirmed urgency and impact levels. This capability ensures that incident management systems are aligned with the latest route decisions and business priorities. - The agent can use the N8N Delivery Route Data Webhook Tool to retrieve and summarize detailed route data based on the stored route ID. This capability allows the agent to present a complete and accurate summary of the route information to the user.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You analyze route options and their calculated impacts to choose an optimal route based on business rules and cost optimization</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-10-06 03:28:34</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>bea5ec6f9fd832107f4424482024abae</sys_id><sys_mod_count>82</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Route Decision Agent</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">71842f6c9f5832107f4424482024ab3a</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">71842f6c9f5832107f4424482024ab3a</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_bea5ec6f9fd832107f4424482024abae</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-08 03:04:27</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_f89165359f9032107f4424482024ab40
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Analyze financial impact of delivery disruptions and create incident tracking</description><instructions>Step 1: Use the Lookup Delivery Delay Record Tool with the route id the user entered. If no route id is provided, find the earliest created record with status pending. Retrieve its eta_minutes values for each proposed route.
Step 2: Find the supply agreement record for the customer id on the delivery delay record. Retrieve the fields deliver_window_hours and stockout_penalty_rate.
Step 3: For each ETA value retrieved from the delivery delay record, call the Calculated Impacts Tool separately. Do NOT pass an array or comma-separated list of ETA values. Instead, call the tool once per ETA (one value at a time). After each call, collect the returned values and combine them into a single JSON object that you store in memory as calculated_impact, in the format: Option 1 - $X.XX Option 2 - $Y.YY Option 3 - $Z.ZZ
Step 4: Present the calculated_impact JSON object to the user for confirmation. THE USER MUST CONFIRM BEFORE YOU USE the Create Incident Tool.
Step 5: Once the user confirms, use the Create Incident Tool with the details from the delivery delay record. Store the incident sys_id in memory.
Step 6: Use the route_id to find and update the delivery delay record with the calculated_impact JSON object and incident sys_id.
Step 7: Thank the user.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_pepsico_de_0.Route Financial Analysis Agent</internal_name><name>Route Financial Analysis Agent</name><proficiency>- The AGENT is proficient in analyzing delivery delays by examining route IDs and ETA values, calculating the financial impact of alternate routes, and updating records with these calculated impacts. This expertise allows the AGENT to effectively manage logistics and minimize costs associated with delivery delays. - The AGENT utilizes the Lookup Delivery Delay Record Tool to access delivery delay records, extracting ETA values for proposed routes. This capability enables the AGENT to gather foundational data required for calculating impacts and making informed decisions. - The AGENT employs the Calculated Impacts Tool to individually assess each ETA value, calculating the financial impact in terms of options with specific monetary values. This capability allows the AGENT to present detailed cost analyses for user confirmation. - The AGENT uses the Create Incident Tool to generate incident records based on delivery delay details, storing the incident sys_id for future reference. This capability ensures that all delivery-related problems are formally documented and can be addressed systematically. - The AGENT updates delivery delay records with the calculated impact JSON object and incident sys_id, ensuring that all relevant information is captured and accessible for future reference. This capability supports effective record-keeping and decision-making processes.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You analyze delivery delays, calculate the cost of alternate routes, create incident records, and update records with calculated impacts.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-30 21:01:06</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>f89165359f9032107f4424482024ab40</sys_id><sys_mod_count>201</sys_mod_count><sys_name>Route Financial Analysis Agent</sys_name><sys_package display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries" source="x_snc_pepsico_de_0">71842f6c9f5832107f4424482024ab3a</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="PepsiCo Deliveries">71842f6c9f5832107f4424482024ab3a</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_f89165359f9032107f4424482024ab40</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-10-06 10:26:14</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>
